abstract: After an Inauguration Day slip, Wall Street bounced back as investors sought bargains. The Dow rose 279 points.
snippet: After an Inauguration Day slip, Wall Street bounced back as investors sought bargains. The Dow rose 279 points.
lead_paragraph: Wall Street bounded back on Wednesday as investors hunted for bargains among battered financial stocks and cheered the prospect that Timothy F. Geithner would be confirmed as President Obama’s Treasury secretary.

headline.print_headline: Bank Sector Helps Shares Bounce Back
